p: Anthelmintics are a group of antiparasitic drugs that expel parasitic worms (helminths) and other internal parasites from the intestine by either stunning or killing them without causing significant damage to the host [ 65]. The methanolic extract of Leea asiatica leaves was shown to exhibit effectiveness against Indian adult earthworms ( Pheretima posthuma) [ 66] suggesting the potential source of Leea asiatica as an anthelmintic.
